King Detta (born Saeed Skinanan on May 14, 2002) is a Trinidadian dancehall artist, songwriter, and LGBTQ+ activist. Known for his openly pro-LGBTQ+ stance in a traditionally conservative genre, he has become a pioneering figure in Caribbean music, celebrated for tracks that center same-sex love and themes of acceptance.
Early life and education
Saeed Skinanan was born and raised in Penal, Trinidad and Tobago. He attended Penal Primary School, where he faced frequent bullying for his outspoken support of LGBTQ+ classmates and for questioning his own sexuality in a conservative society.
At Siparia West Secondary School, he found comfort in songwriting. His lyrics often reflected his struggles with being attracted to boys and the guilt he felt for not returning romantic interest from girls. Music became a way for him to process and challenge the cultural stigma surrounding LGBTQ+ identity.
Musical career
At age 17, Skinanan adopted the stage name King Detta. His breakout single, "Brave Love" (2019), featured candid lyrics about same-sex attraction and self-acceptance, making him one of the first dancehall artists in Trinidad and Tobago to address LGBTQ+ themes openly.
His discography includes:
* "Rainbow Dance" – an anthem celebrating LGBTQ+ pride.
* "Hearts Like Ours" – about secret crushes on boys.
* "Against the Waves" – describing growing up LGBTQ+ in a conservative society.
His work has been praised for blending dancehall rhythms with vulnerable, personal storytelling.
Activism
King Detta is an outspoken advocate for LGBTQ+ rights. He supports organizations like CAISO: Sex & Gender Justice and the Silver Lining Foundation, performing at pride events and fundraisers.
In 2022, he launched the initiative "Detta for Change", which provides mentorship and counseling for LGBTQ+ youth in rural Trinidad.
Personal life
Detta has publicly discussed the challenges he faced in accepting his sexuality, particularly the conflict between societal expectations and his own feelings. He continues to live in Penal, surrounded by supportive friends and family, and remains committed to creating music that inspires self-acceptance and change.
Awards and recognition
* Best Dancehall Act – Caribbean Youth Music Awards (2021, 2022)
* Courage in Music Award – Trinidad & Tobago LGBTQ+ Alliance (2022)
* Humanitarian Artist of the Year – Silver Lining Foundation (2023)
Legacy
King Detta is recognized as the first openly pro-LGBTQ+ dancehall artist from Trinidad and Tobago, using his platform to promote love, equality, and acceptance.
